column4: in the ubuntuguide.org it says i can goto Applications > System Tools > Menu Editor, but that does not exist
any ideas?
u have to install that
Hence why it is the Un-official guide ;)
wget http://myosc.org/ubuntuguide/menueditor_0.4.3ubuntu1_all.deb
dpkg -i menueditor_0.4.3ubuntu1_all.deb
He assumed you had downloaded the program that I had directed you to.
That's all ;)
current directory ;)
i.e., open a terminal - run the wget cmd, and then run dpkg to install it ;)
Now, the Menu Editor or whatever it was called should be there and you should be all set...
Ubuntu ROCKS! :)
is because the item in your menu is probably 'system wide' or in other words, you don't have the right privileges to erase such item in the menu.
what you have just said conflicts with what ogra has just said
however, if you create a menu item as current user - you will be able to delete/etc. it.
The menu editor basically does this...
There are files that contain information - in fact - think of it the same way microsoft windows handles menu's, with .lnk files and such...
Manually do it
Or, run the Menu editor AS root
sudo file
i'd quite like to get rid of these menu items!
I understand - I'm looking for the menu 'stuff' in my filesystem right now lol
Do what ogra said
